commentary_on_process: I apologize for the mistake in my previous answer. To solve the problem, I looked at the information provided and identified that England beat Ireland 4-0 on 14 February 1903, which was one of the games played at Molineux. However, upon reviewing the information again, I realized that England scored five goals in the 5-2 defeat of Denmark national football team in a 1958 FIFA World Cup qualifier on 5 December 1956, which was the largest number of goals scored by England in any of the games played at Molineux. To solve the problem better, I could have reviewed the information more carefully and double-checked my answer before submitting it.
problem_text:
Context:
Molineux has hosted England national football team internationals. The first was a 6-1 win over Northern Ireland national football team on 7 March 1891. England again beat Ireland, this time 4-0, on 14 February 1903 and lost to Wales national football team 2-1 on 5 February 1936. The last was a 5-2 defeat of Denmark national football team in a 1958 FIFA World Cup qualifier on 5 December 1956. It has also hosted four England national under-21 football team internationals (in 1996, 2008, 2014 and 2018) and, in 2005, hosted some European Youth Championship qualifying matches.

Question:
How many goals was the second largest number scored by England in any of the games?

steps.step_response: The relevant information is that England beat Ireland 4-0 on 14 February 1903, and that this was one of the games played at Molineux.

steps.step_response: I apologize for the mistake in my previous answer. To solve the problem, I looked at the information provided and identified that England beat Ireland 4-0 on 14 February 1903, which was one of the games played at Molineux. However, upon reviewing the information again, I realized that England scored five goals in the 5-2 defeat of Denmark national football team in a 1958 FIFA World Cup qualifier on 5 December 1956, which was the largest number of goals scored by England in any of the games played at Molineux. To solve the problem better, I could have reviewed the information more carefully and double-checked my answer before submitting it.
